humanum_full_description_en:
From the " mouth ", " may " sound to indicate scold, yell. "Historical Records: Biography of Uncle Tian": "The master's family is all weird and evil. Don't dare."

" Heh " can mean shouting, ordering pedestrians to give way. Tang Hanyu's "Preface to Sending Li Yuan to Banggu": "People who are called great husbands...If they are outside, they will be stunned, Luo Gongshi, Wu Fu Qian, and the followers will stop the road.

" Ha " also means hushing and breathing. "Guan Yinzi‧ Two Pillars": "Oh it is warm, and blowing it is cool."

" He " is also used as an auxiliary word. Song Zhou Bangyan "Manluhua·Siqing": "It is very emotional, but you forget me."

humanum_full_description:
從「口」，「可」聲，表示責罵、喝斥。《史記‧田叔列傳》：「主家皆怪而惡之，莫敢呵。」

　　「呵」可表示喝道，喝令行人讓路。唐韓愈〈送李願歸盤谷序〉：「人之稱大丈夫者……其在外，則樹旗旄，羅弓矢，武夫前呵，從者塞途。」

　　「呵」也表示噓氣、哈氣。《關尹子‧二柱》：「呵之即溫，吹之即涼。」

　　「呵」也用作助詞。宋周邦彥〈滿路花‧思情〉：「著甚情悰，你但忘了我呵。」
